sn22.51:1.2: “Mendicants, form really is impermanent. A mendicant sees that it is impermanent: that’s their right view.
sn22.51:1.4: When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
sn22.51:1.5: When relishing and greed end, the mind is freed, and is said to be well freed.
sn22.51:1.15: Consciousness really is impermanent. A mendicant sees that it is impermanent: that’s their right view.
sn22.51:1.17: When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
sn22.51:1.18: When relishing and greed end, the mind is freed, and is said to be well freed.”
